text: Bottled. 20cl sample. The aroma has port tones, caramel, dried fruits, honey. Hazy, brown coloured beer with an off-white, thin head. The taste is light bitter, light-moderate sweet and has caramel, dried fruits and some agd port tones. Medium-full bodied. Pretty nice stuff.

Pours without any sing of a head. Thick abmer in the glass. Wine-ish fruity aroma. Overripe stonefruits. Light sour. Taste is also bit sour with lots of fruit. Some sweet peaches with hops shining through and leading to the thick and alcoholic finish.
The finish is like a liqueur. Alcoholic and smooth round. Without any hard edges.
It does not feel like 10%. Feels like almost 15-20%! Thick oily mouthfeel (24% Stammwürze!)

375ml bottle BB 15 Jan 2018. Dark amber with small off white head that recedes quickly. Big rich aromas of booze, peach, papaya, banana bread. The taste is also highly decadent - big tropical fruitiness, pineapple, papaya, melon, some banana, rich caramel, prominent warming alcohol. Big full bodied chewy beer. Quite good but possibly a bit too much of a good thing.

Draught at Ginger Man Boston, 5/3/17.Glassy amber-auburn with a small, beige head showing moderate to low retention.Unsurprisingly there is plentiful malt character in the nose showing bread and caramel being met by light oxidation and lots of melanoidins that help balance all of the sweetness. Also of surprise, it doesnt seem messy or boozy for its size, no doubt owing to the large amount of malt, but one hops also due to the proper lagering time. Some vivacious yellow and orange fruit notes, also stemming from the malt, help keep things from getting too bogged down in acidic melanoidins and rich caramel.First impressions in the mouth are quite lovely. Soft smoke in to cherry-caramel and finally ending on proper balancing acidity for the style from the meladnoidins. Alcohol is no where to be found and the texture is, of course, soft, supple, malt-and-wheat-heavy with low carbonation but no syrupiness. Rich, rewarding and not cloying, though my days of drinking these things are long over and a sample is plenty.

Bouteille 2016. Une robe brune étang vraiment trouble. Un nez de caramel, de fruits confits, blé et fruits. Une bouche que jai trouvée mince, légèrement sucrée avec des notes acides de blé, de caramel et touche de fruits confits. Manque de caractère.

750 ml Bottle. Pours with a cloudy, copper color and a small white head. Very nice nose: sweet & fruity. Peach, bananas, oranges and some tropical fruits. Honey & yeast. Taste is sweet and complex. Overripe fruits, caramel, honey, some grains. Malty and yeasty. Full bodied. Very nice!

Draught at Wvrst. Hazy copper-gold, small head. Aroma is big and sweet - fermented orange, marzipan, banana - with notes of clove and a yeasty tang. Flavour follows a similar path, with a bit of booze in the finish. Medium-full body, but creamy on the palate. A lot going on, but never confused or confusing. Well done.

Nice bottle but not all information on the labels,
Clear red-brown beer with a small and short cream-colored head, smell is malty and alcohol, taste is malty, light sweet, overripe fruit, last summer days, 
(I have 0.33l bottle with best-before 15.01.2018 and from limited version 2016)

[9029-20170218] 1pt9.4floz bottle. Fruity alcohol grains aroma. Clear, dark orange body with no lasting head. Sweet boozy fruity grains flavour. Medium-full body. Good. (7/3/8/3/15) 3.6
(w/ jercraigs, mds)
Dunkelorangefarben ohne Schaum. Tropische Früchte gepaart mit leichten Alknoten im hefigen Körper. Gut süffig.

Bottle from Boxbeers. Hazy amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is sweet, wheaty, yeasty, oranges, light spicy and light alcohol. Flavor is quite sweet. Sweet finish with a little warming alcohol. Oily. 070517

Cloudy honey orange, small head. The aroma reminded me of a barleywine. Honey, melon, marmelade. Additional banana. Full body. Creamy texture. Medium sweet taste. Powerful esters, nuts, well hidden alco. High range.

How: bottle Appearance: hazy light brown/orangeish, tiny tiny off-white head. Aroma: strong honey scent, peach, apricots, apples, bread, grass, yeast, prunes, orange cest. Palate: full body, soft carbonation.
Bronze coloured beer. Smells like a nice barley wine, tons of malt on malts. Sweet and very complex, layers of bready malts. Full bodied and luxurious.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Kleine Bierstube, Aarhus. Pours clear amber orange with a white head. Aroma and taste is malt, sweet fruits, honey, bread, caramel notes. Full body. Soft carbonation. Light bitter warming finish.
Draft. Amber pour hazed. Tis is too thick and sweet.. Syrupym scheider is known for innovation of which this is not.

Green bottle, 750 ml, best before 15.01.2018, purchased at the LCBO - King Edward, savoured on April 20 2017; eye: caramel with an orangey hue, hazy, no effervescence, ring of tan head, no lacing; nose: malt, wheat, clove, light fruity, light alcohol, slight fig; mouth: malt, wheat, clove, light fruity, light alcohol, slight alcohol warmth, fig, finale in malt with presence of spices, medium body, average carbonation, lightly sweet, slightly harsh texture; overall: fine

FRANÇAIS

Bouteille verte, 750 ml, meilleure avant 15.01.2018, achetée à la LCBO - King Edward, savourée le 24 août 2016; il : caramel avec une teinte orangée, trouble, pas deffervescence, anneau de mousse fauve, pas de dentelle; nez : malt, blé, clou de girofle, léger fruité, léger alcool, très léger figue; bouche : malt, blé, clou de girofle, léger fruité, léger alcool, très léger chaleur dalcool, figue, finale en malt avec présence dépices, corps moyen, carbonatation moyenne, légèrement sucrée, texture très légèrement râpeuse; en résumé : bien

Best before date on back label is 15.01.2018. Pours a hazy amber colour with a warm cap, somewhat retention and minimal lacing. Apple juice smell with other dark fruits, bananas and light alcohol. Quite smooth in the mouth with the alcohol well-hidden. Again, lots of fruits in the taste with mild caramel and good hops before the finish, creating some nice bitterness. Some hints of nuttiness. Goes down quite nicely.
Bottle from de Fles Winkel. Honey apricot color with minimal head. Smells fruity and sweet with some bread. Sweet and fruity flavor.
Bottle (75 cl) from Systembolaget. Clear amber, medium off-white head. Fruity, fudgy aroma, som floral hops. Full bodied, high carbonation. Semi sweet, low to medium bitterness.
Bottle at the April Fools Day DC Ratebeer tasting. Aroma was some dried fruits - raisins, plum, with some honey notes. Flavor was some boozy raisins, sweet malts. Some wheat grain character.

Omg is that a barley wine or what? Strong honey and dried fruit scents. Lots of raisins and caramel. Very sweet and smooth. Slick mouthfeel. The alcohol is there in both aroma and taste but plays a background pleasant role rather than a bothering and overpowering main part
Wonderful beer and excellent master work for style from the OGs of this shit like Colors. Florals and citrus, with banana and coriander. Light sweet finish. Bottle.

Amber, hazy, creamy head. Aroma strawberries, prunes, bubblegum and vanilla. Palate thick and silky, smooth carbonation. Taste cotton candy, apricot, honey. Warming smooth finish. Dried raisins and nuts in aftertaste. Great desert beer.
Świetny Weizenbock. Wyraźny aromat owoców, wygląd średni, a w smaku truskawki.

Bottle from HomeBrewStuff. Muddy amber, plum colored. Small, silky ring of head. Sweet, boozy aroma, plums and pit fruit. Taste is also sweet, fruit, alcohol, plums. Slick, chewy mouthfeel. Perfect Sunday afternoon sipper.

Dark brown color with minimal head. Aroma of honey, plums and raisins. Taste is very sweet. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
On Tap at Prost! Boise Foggy deep golden. Rich smooth sweet thick light maltiness. Some ABV burn but the sweet pale light toasted maltiness blends wonderfully. Delicious.

Draft 0.25l at Little Delirium Amsterdam, The Netherlands. 02.02.2017. Taste with kermis. Pour it dark orange color with small white head. Aroma biscuit, alcohol, some sweet spice bread. Taste sweet honey, kick of alcohol a lot, little bit bitter on the end, nice sweet toffee, skunky, heavy cloying sweetness, medium to full body, sticky, thick feel, soft carbonation, long finish. Good!

Capped 375 from Craft Shack. Pours translucent copper with a very transient white head. Aroma of fruit and brown sugar with a little heat impact. Its amazing. Its wonderful. Full bodied. Flavor is fruit, brown sugar and enough hop to somewhat fend off the sugar. Despite the "malt" its actually somewhat astringent. New thing? Not tart/sour, but sweet/astringent. Ok, this is really difficult to put into words. This may be one of the top 100 weizen bocks. Or better. Its opening up a whole new world of beer deliciousness.
75cl bottle. Hazy orangish amber with a small white head. Caramel, malts, banana, prunes and biscuit. Good.
Pours foggy orange brown with very small carbonation. Aroma is a little boozy, toffee. Taste is resiny, boozy, some alcohol burn. Low carbonation, slight plum. Really nice sipper.

Cloudy golden amber with a lasting white head. Aroma of bready malt aroma with banana, sweet apples, winegum, dried fruit and vinous alcohol. Sweet fruity flavour with malty notes and quite a bit of alcohol.

Bottle from Geers, Gent - BE. Color: dark amber brown beer with no carbonation and medium ivory creamy foam. Smell: full caramel and malt nose domination, bread. Taste: full body with strong caramel malt domination, bread. Good attenuation, caramel finish. Small alcohol hint. Aftertaste: alcohol, caramel and bread.

750ml bottle. Clear copper with a foamy white head. Flavors are banana, cherries, dried fruits, caramel and alcohol with spicy and syrupy notes. Medium to full body, soft to moderate carbonation, oily texture.

750ml bottle, dark amber co,or, with a white-beige head, with a very nice spicy, fruity weizen yeast nose, with some fruitcake, mild cinnamon, nutmeg, clove, faint dry raisin, date, fig, prune, toffee, fruity toasted, cafe elle, biscuity, wheat malty accents, and a ripe apple, subtle port wine, faint barley sugar note in the aroma follows through on a medium-bodied palate with a warmth fruity sweet toasted, caramel, bready, wheat malty, barley sugar, subtle brandyish character, with some light boozy candied juicy dried raisin, date, fig, faint cinnamon apple strudel dough, raisin pie, subtle caramel apple on a stick, toffee flavours, leading towards a warming mild brandyish, candied apple fruitiness, toffee, yeasty, sweet toasted, caramel, biscuity, wheat maltiness finish.
Bottle, LCBO. Lovely brew. Malty, slightly wheaty, with sweet fruity notes, a bit like a cherry thing going on there. A bit boozy but thats alright. Wont write more, must enjoy.

2017-02-18. Red amber body with a small beige head. Aroma of cherry with wood accents, notes of wheat. Flavour is sweetish, lightly tart accents, sweet wheat. Kiss of wood? Alcohol is exceptionally restrained. Smooth average bodied palate, soft carbonation. Super interesting, enjoyable. 7/3/7-8/3/16 Bottle from the LCBO, Toronto.
Rich aroma with notes of spice and fruit. Dark copper colour. Flavour of burnt caramel, peach, and maple. Medium body with low carbonation. Very tasty brew.
750ml Bottle - Dark amber in colour. Biscuity malt, caramel and apricot in the aroma. Rich taste with caramel, nuts, biscuity malt, apricot and pine. Indulgent and fairly boozy yet easy to drink.

Vintage 2016. Moze bylo by lepsze i bardziej ulozone gdybym przetrzymal troche w piwniczce. No ale mamy tu niewielka prawie zerowa piane, kolor pomaranczowy, lekko metny. Aromat dojrzalych moreli i bananow, naprawde silny aromat, w smaku zas nazbyt alkoholowe, likierowe i slodkie, troche za malo chmielnej i wytrawnej kontry. Ale i tak przyjemnie smakowalo i poprawialo smak kaszy gryczanej z sosem tajskim.

375ml bottle shared at home. Hazy dark reddish brown with a small somewhat off-white head. Full body with low carbonation. Well balanced sweet and bitter tones. Caramel, ripe red fruits, wheat, malts, hops and honey. Very good.

bottle 2016 amber cloudy almost flat ripe fruit cherry dried fruit light liquor medium dryness bit warming low bitterness
bel ambrato brillante piuttosto torbida pochissima schiuma caramello frutta matura cherry frutta secca un leggero liquoroso discreta seccheza un filo alcolico risaldante poco amara poco gassata

03-01-17 // bottle at home. Pours an amber red orange beer, almost clear, small white head. Nose is alcoholic with sweet dried fruits. Taste is pretty intense, with some dried fruits some spices, light bitter notes in the end.

75cl. Bottle. 
Pours clear amberish orange with white head. 
Aroma caramel, banana, red fruits, spice, very fruity. 
Taste red fruits, caramel, honey sweets, a nice little bitter. 
Mouthfeel oily smooth. 
Awesome beer.

750 mml bottle tasted on the 01/01/2017. Reddish amber colour with a minimal white head. Aroma of berries, strawberries, caramel and wood. Taste is intense fruity with predominance of berries and strawberries. Finish is dry and very intense. Next one please!

750 ml bottle from LCBO. Pours a cloudy orange colour with small off-white head. Aroma is rich toffee, bread, banana and some other fruit. Flavour is quite rich with lots of toffee, caramelized banana, raisin, bread and some tree fruit. Average plus body. Slick mouthfeel. Solid.

Draft. Banana, orange, clove, wheat malt, and straw aroma. Cloudy amber wtih nice head. Moderately sweet orange, banana, clove, wheat malt and moderate bitter alcohol/hay flavor. Great body. Excellent.

Jasnomiedziane z bardzo przeciętną pianą. W aromacie jabłko, trochę gruszki, bananów. Sporo jest toffi, karmelu, są też rodzynki i delikatna nuta korzenna. Zapachy kojarzące mi się z koźlakami - skórki od chleba, tostów etc występują, ale nie są dominujące. W smaku słodkie, znów sporo wcześniej wspomnianego jabłka i bananów, są też delikatne posmaki landrynek i suszonych owoców, bardziej kojarzące się z barley wine, choć oczywiście nie są one dominujące i nawet tutaj pasują. Jeszcze raz dużo toffi i nieco wyraźniejsze melanoidyny. Pełne, gęste, sycące, nisko wysycone. Niestety trochę zbyt alkoholowe, ale tak czy inaczej świetne piwo.
Bottle shared with a friend at the Brauhaus Edinburgh. Full bodied, well-rounded and balanced beer. Sweet, but not cloying, with clove yeast flavours.

Bottle at home, 15th January 17. Pours Amber, little carbonation, no head. Aroma is sweet, caramel, slight banana. Taste is complex, sweet, little carbonation, slick mouth feel, fruit, bananas, too sweet for me, OK
Great fruity beginning. Intense with a smooth sweetness, nice clove yeast, fresh and mild. Fantastic mild smooth aftertaste, nice yeast, round and refreshing with lots of depth. Great!

Bottle. Pours a hazy orange color with a small white head. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy hoppy aroma. Fruity wheat malty spicy caramel flavor. Has a fruity wheat malty spicy caramel finish with weak hoppy hints.

Flaska från SB. En stor vetebock med extra allt. Stor kropp med stor sötma men också viss vetesyrlighet. Stora djupa och komplexa smaker i fin balans. Vetedeg, stenfrukt, banan, päron, marsipan. Riktigt gott.

(Flasche) Es hat eine orange Farbe, ist leicht trüb mit einer weißen Schaumkrone. Das Aroma ist säuerlich, würzig, mit Alkohol, Kiwi und Quitte. Der Geschmack ausschließlich Alkohol, es ist schwer zu trinken, malzig und mit viel Pfirsich.

Bottled, from Systembolaget.  Cloudy amber, rich head. Phenolic bubblegum and pear aroma. Mid sweet with medium-full body and dense, rounded mouthfeel. Citrus, pears, banana and wood. Peppery warming finish.

Pours dark honey colored from the bottle. The thin head is of brief duration and the body as a whole has a rather low level of carbonation. Smell is banana, apple, cognac, although in reading that back it sounds a little too generous. On the whole the aroma is nice but failed to really draw me in. Taste is fruity, with lots of apple, and a bit tart. An underlying layer of banana is (just) noticeable beneath the tart, apple brandy notes. Finishes warm, lightly alcoholic. Pleasant by the fire on a cold winter night.
750 ml bottle shared by my bro at xmas dinner. big boozy dopple-weizenbock. drinkable for its weight and complex. nice beer, thx Ryan!

It pours murky copper with amber highlights; the head is beige and foamy. The aroma has notes of: toffee, fig, raisins, grapefruit zest, and biscuit. The taste is medium sweet that finishes medium bitter. The palate is medium-heavy bodied with light carbonation, and has a medium finish. Overall, very well crafted.

Bottle, [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Kolding. Pours hazy amber with a small, disappearing off-white film head. Aroma has sweet malts, caramel, fine fat wheat, light vinious, light nutty. Medium carbonation, fine dry and quite creamy mouthfeel. Flavour has fat malts, light sugary, wheat, vinious, walnuts. Nice and elegant.
Bottle. Apples, bananas, oranges and spices on nose. Sour taste firstly. Sweet apple nextly. Extreme fruity and full bodied beer. Tasty and desert.

Danke an Willems Urenkel! Geruch Aprikose, Pfirsich, Honig. Ziemlich süßer Start, Kuchen, Zitrus. Mitte süß, Holzfaß, malzig. Abgang hefig und süß, leicht nach Zitrus gehend, holzig, ein wenig Alkohol der wärmt. Gut.
Opaque dark orange, small off white foam ring. Light aroma, some hay notes. Warm complex in taste, alcohol present, interesting, hard to define. Good. (Velp 201612)

SB Lund, flaska. Födelsedagspresent i Lund från Carola. Nu ska vi se.
Påminner om Hopfenweisse, gamla goa Hopfenweisse. ...
Bärnsten och fina slingor av hefe. Verkligen rät till ost, rochefour.
Fruktig och välhumlad. Mycket malt för att vara Schneider. Blandning av Hopfenweisse och barley wine.....
Great taste, nice aroma but not very intensive with magnificent smell of banana.
Decent weizenbock, fresh and well priced at the LCBO. Very good lace and drinkability. A bit sweet, hiding the alcohol.

Slightly hazy Copper pour, with a small beige head. Aroma is quite bready, lots if toffee and sweet cereals with a solid sticky, resinous pine notes and alot of earthy malted wheat. Aroma reminds me alot of a Barley wine. This is a big, thick, sticky, sweet winter sipper. Alcohol is well hidden, lots of pine, and sweet malted wheat. Low bitterness high sweetness and solid fruity esters with lots of yeast in the end.
From a bottle. Pours a clear caramel color with an off white head. Aroma of toffee. Flavors of caramel and pine. Smooth, creamy texture and finish.
Bottle. Hazy brown orange, small white head. Sweet rye bread aroma, the taste is really sweet and has some good notes of whisky at the end.
Draught at Beer Trappe. Nice bright orange with tons of banana and slight sweetness. Good stuff.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ Beer Session. Amber colour, mediumsized white head. Aroma is wheat, toffee, some slight alcohol as well as some zesty and frutiy notes. Flavour is quite similar in a quite nice balance. Wellbalanced and pleasant.

Bottled 750ml (Systembolaget)
Deep amber color, small beige head. Riped banana, strawberry aroma with some alcohol. Medium to full-bodied . Sweet banana, some spiceyness, alcohol, berryish. Quite sweet although mellow.

750 ml bottle from LCBO, served quite cool in a tulip glass. 
App.: Murky reddish-amber with a moderate and tight orange-white head.
 
Aroma: Sweet and malty, caramel/toffee/treacle, quite a lot of berry-like fruitiness, a bit spicy and a bit tangy (sour cherries), toasted bread crust and melanoidins, light banana-like esters, a little booze.
 
Palate: Medium+ body, low to moderate carbonation.
 
Flav.: Big malt and fruit presence, malt is toffee, toasted bread crust, melanoidin, toffee, fruit is strawberries, sour cherries, more berries, banana-like esters round things out with a bit of spiciness and booziness to give some edges to the overall profile; lightly sweet with moderate bitterness and a lightly tangy, malty, fruity, boozy and estery finish.

Glad I bought two bottles!

Bottle from Beer Square, Santiago. Pours a hazy orange color wih a small bubbly head that disappears mostly pretty fast. Aroma is intensely fruity with notes of honey, mango, apple fritters, cinnamon, cake, biscuit, donuts, refined sugars and a bit of lemon. Quite nice considering the lack of head. Taste is delicious, chewy cake and fruit salad. Spices like cinnamon and clove, orange, mango and papaya. What a delight! Big mouthfeel, chewy and sticky. A very nice, well crafted dessert beer. Underrated.

Dark copper, fairly fizzy, minimal head. Caramel, woody, pot pourri. Malty and quite well done flavour but not quite as powerful as hoped. Barley wine aroma but the taste doesnt quite match modern craft or the best German bock or doppelsticke. Still nice though and great choice for a cold night. (50cl bottle from Saveur Bière)

0,75 l bottle, shared with Kristall-König at home. Unclear bright orange in the glass, small short living head. Smells strong fruity, honey, hoppy, alcoholic. Taste starts smooth, honey, some melone in the background. Less alcoholic. Not bad but expected a little bit more.

750ml bottle with mini-card bought at Running Beers booth at Harbourfront in Central during Hong Kong Wine & Dine Festival Expo 2016.
Looks: Translucent amber honey colour with a ring of dirt-like yeast sediments; Three quarter finger head with soapy off-white foam which lasted for 1 minute; Fair sticky lacing and active small carbonation.

Aroma: Very fragment and sweet malt, with wheaty tartness, strong honey, strong gooseberry, dark berries, strong banana, grapefruits, caramel, strong floral, sugar, resins, sweet bread, yeast, lemon and grass.

Taste: Strong sweet amber malt, with strong caramel, strong toffee, strong banana, wheaty tartness, strong alcohol, floral, strong molasses, spices, light bread, yeast, fair lemon and medium bitter grassy hops. Pretty intense!

Body: Medium body. Slick and oily palate.

Mouth Feel: Strong, Ambrée-like maltyness in a pretty thick background. Full on tasty caramel and toffee with strong booze, which suppresses much of wheatyness. Flowery and very sweet but in a pleasant way. Spicy and light bready with lemon to round. Hard hitting!

Booziness: the 10% abv is liquorish, notably strong in sweet smell and butt-naked in taste, yet its balanced well by toffee and caramel. Got some knock on after half a pint, but in a pleasant way. Okay.

Hoppiness: strong gooseberry, dark berries, grapefruits, strong floral, resins, lemon and grass in nose. Floral, spices, lemon and gras in taste; Bitterness is fair for a lasting, medium astringent sweet malty finish.

After Taste: Fairly dry. Boozy sweet and fairly bitter to mouth.

Comments: This is more like an Eisbock then a Weizenbock, as its aroma and taste is pretty much resembles a strong Belgian Ambrée. The pleasantly fruity hop and banana ester aroma could not mask the overtly strong booziness and its taste is not as complex as Tap 5 Meine Hopfen-Weisse. Very nice to drink, but I like the Tap 5 and Tap 6 (Aventinus) better. Worth trying, but better share it with friends! 

P.S. Not bad for my 1700th rating, but I will get even with a great one for the 1800th! ;)

Heavy body, aroma reminds me of tinned fruit cocktail. Little/no head. Gorgeous red hues with very light trace of carbonation. Honey, fruity taste only just masking the heavy hitting booze packed in this beer.

Bottle, 375ml. A mahogany beer with minimal white head. Aroma is of alcohol, dried fruits and wood. Taste is medium sweet with low bitterness. Medium bodied with a dried fruits character and flzzy carbonation. Fiery alcoholic finish.

Bottle, 375. Clear dark orange, creamy to minimal tan head. Complex dried fruits and alcohol aromas. Medium bodied, soft carbonation. Very, very smooth. Medium to heavy sweet, medium to light bitter. Seems boozy because of the sweetness.

Hazy, orange-amber colored, small off white head. Aroma is sweet, sugary, some malt and caramel, carob, spicy, some fruity notes, bit toast, also must at first. Taste is very sweet malt and sugar, caramel, toffee, fruity candy, carob, toast, spicy, light+ bitterness, some alcohol. Full bodied, soft to flat carbonation, sticky.

Bottle from beer[malade], Rusovce. Amber golden color with medium white head. Aroma of sweet malt,banana, caramel, bready notes. Taste, sweet caramel malt, banana, dates, dried fruits, clove, banana, citrus hops in background. Warming alcohol. Tasty.

Bottle at Schneider Bräuhaus Weisses, Munich. Pours clear tawny with a medium, frothy off-white head, short retention with good lacing. Aroma is moderate sweet kettle caramelized wheat malt, bread and cookie malt notes with light alcohol, medium pear, apple and apricot esters. Flavor is moderate sweet wheat malt, bread and cookie malt with light, spicy alcohol, dates, figs and pear, apple and apricot esters and a sweet finish. Full body and medium carbonation. This was a perfect accompaniment and follow up to my farmer sausage, kale and potato plate.
UPDATED: NOV 13, 2016 Draft at Khyber Pass. Very hazy dark golden chestnut pour. Sweet medium caramel malts. Swollen brown banana. Dark blue cabbage and kale. Dried blueberries. Deep and rich.

Piany niewiele, barwa pomarańczowo bursztynowa, lekko mętna. W aromacie suszone owoce w typie rodzynek, śliwek, jabłek, karmel, miód pitny, słodkie wino, migdały. W smaku analogicznie, dochodzą kandyzowane morele, jakaś mineralność ocierająca się o sól morską, wino głogowe, odrobina ciemnego czerstwego chleba, miód lipowy, może lekki banan, ale to już raczej doszukuję się na siłę... Goryczki niewiele, nagazowanie niskie, alkohol mocno rozgrzewający, raczej rzadkie jak na 24 Plato.

Bardzo ciekawe, bogate piwo, może jest nieco za wysoki alkohol (kwestia ułożenia się - data do 15/01/18), ale sama paleta aromatyczno smakowa mi pasuje.

Bottle
Aroma-tropical fruits
Appearance-amber, hazy, white foam, 
Taste-medium sweetness, lightly bitter, lightly sour, 
Palate-medium body, sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 
Overall-very good

Lätt dimmig, orange, jäkligt snyggt orange skum. Doft: Jord, malt, skog, fräsch växt doft, milt citrus kola. Svag 7:a. Smak: Humle, söt humle, kola, lätt kanderat socker, söta barr, söt malt, kola med konstgjord frukt smak.

Aroma:honey,caramel,banana,peach
Appearace:amber color,small head.
Taste:sweet,flavour of honey,banana,bread,toasted malt,caramel and dark fruits,slighlty bitter boozy finish.
Palate:full body,low carbonation,slightly boozy.
Overall:Nice one.

Bottle sample at a tasting at The Dancing Camel. Thanks David. Hazy amber-orange. A little funky, heavily fruity aroma with notes of mango and oranges. Bitter, fruity, raspberry and the bitter, hoppiness and then alcohol. Full body, bitter and alcoholic, fruity finish.

Small head, off-white, over deep-copper beer, finely carbonated. Cognac, banana, faint smoked ham, glue. Sweet, banana, hint at bitterish, strong alcohol impression. Quite some solvent/glue too. Very slick-viscous-oily; important alcoholwarming, oozing. Wry-bitter aftertaste. The opposite - the EXACT opposite of quaffing ale.

Tap. Pours very hazy hazel, large beige creamy head, dissipates slowly, good lacing. Aroma is boozy, wheat wine, lemon, banana. Flavors is quite sweet, boozy, toffee, clove, banana. Decent bitterness that lingers to the far finish. Medium body, creamy mouthfeel.

Cascading with only a little head. Apple cider and peach aroma doughy yeast. Big body, sticky full of malts. Leaves a semi dry wheaty palate like a weizen but you cam sense the alcohol early on. Resiny syruppy with a lot wheat. Palate has some warming after a few sips. Cool weizenbock. "Like a dunkelweizen on steroids" [email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */ thanks for sharing bruv!

0.75l bottle. Hazy dark orange body, thin white head. Interesting that it showed a bit similar cascading effect like if it was on nitro. Aroma of cider, peach, toast, yeast and some berries. Taste of banana, toast, caramel, lemon zest, peach, apples and citruses. Thick, sweet and fruity. Very nice beer.

Hazy, dark orange beer with a one finger high head. 
 
Nose: Caramel, dried fruit, red berries, honey, plum, vinegar, clove and spices. 
Taste: Caramel malt, alcohol, brown sugar, syrup, honey, toffee, raisin, banana and fruit. 
Mouth: Medium to full body. Light carbonation.

Hazy caramel pour with no head. Very sweet aroma; caramel, apricots, cherry, berries. Sugary with some roasted notes. High on the alcohol 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours hazy dark apricot with a low white head. Aromas of tropical fruit jam, ripe apples, candied peach, caramel, honey, roasted oak. Taste is quite sweet with slight roasted notes and some dessert wine character. Mouthfeel is oily and slightly sticky with moderate carbonation.

750ml bottle from Systembolaget. Hazy amber, mid-size white head, weak lacing. Sweet and spicy aroma, honey, cloves, plums, raisins and pineapple. Mildly carbonated, full-bodied, sweet and soft mouthfeel. Sweet fruity and sugary taste, honey, caramel, raisins, pineapple, coconut, cloves and banana. Too sweet...

Big bottle from web SB cons 2016-09-30 Göteborg
AR: sweet yeasty, frosted banana foam, light baking syrup
AP: dark hazy bronze, wee little bubbly ofwhite head
F: wee grainy, heavy sugary, banana foam, sweet yeasty, warming feeling, touch of Tokaj wine, rich carbonation,

Almost clear dark amber with white head. Aroma of mustard, dates, figs og dried apricot. Very sweet taste. Notes of bananas. Finish slightly bitter and with a taste of sweet cherries. Interesting. I like it!

Bottle shared at THT. Near clear amber with a white head. Aroma of yeast, malt, light herbal notes, citrus and green grassy notes. Flavour is above moderate sweet and light moderate bitter. Medium bodied with soft carbonation. [26-08-2016]

L:
-pours a mostly clear golden-amber with a small,frothy,offwhite head
-low to medium carbonation visible
S:
-honey,clove,spicy,plums,basil,balsam vinegar,red wine,caramel,sugar beet syrup
T:
-alcohol,alcohol,alcohol
-very sweet,plums,red apple,cooked potatoes,balsamic vinegar
-finishes very dry
F:
-medium carbonation
-medium body
-boozy
O:
I love Schneider and their "TapX" Series has been great so far, but this is a mess.
The Aroma offers something unique, but the taste is quite dull and its just an unpleasant experience with its booziness.
Bottle from Systembolaget. Pours hazy, murky brown with off white head. Aroma and taste of figs, dried plum, banana, cloves, honey and spices. A little bit too sweet but overall quite nice.
Disig orange till bärnstensfärgad öl med gulvitt skum. Doft och smak av skumbanan, mörka frukter, karamell och lätt kryddighet.
Draft. Cloudy amber color with a ted hue. Aroma of plum, cherry, vanilla, lemon. Taste is fruity, complex, vinous, subtle tannins. Very tasty.

Flaska från SB. I sötaste laget men väldigt gott. Annorlunda, smak och doft av torkad frukt, grön banan, övermoget päron, karamell, jäst, resin, vete med toner av fallfrukt och smörkola. Fin maltsötma, rund och len, kryddig och maffig kropp, lätt beska. Mmm, gott!
Murky. Honey flavoured beeswax bananas banofee pie beautiful bottle smell of whiskey single malt. Alreet our kid thank you please.

This is lovely. Bottle from Cornelius. Pours auburn, lacy off white head. Figs, honey, hint of spice on the aroma. It has a fantastic thick smooth rounded mouthfeel. Loads of honey on the taste and dark fruit, some spice and nutmeg. Outstanding.
Bottle at THT tasting. Hazy amber pour, no head. Aroma of tropical fruits, banana, wheat and alcohol. Flavor is very sweet, fruity and slightly spicy. Nice body.

Bottle at the August THT, Den Haag. Poured a hazy medium amber with a frothy broken white head. The aroma is sweet toffee caramel malt. The flavour is moderate sweet with a floral hop bitter, alcoholic palate. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

Sampled at THT August. Bottle shared. Hazy light amber/ dark golden with white head. Sweet malts, grain, banana candy, spices, bit boozy, white raisans. Big sweet. Over medium body, low carbonation. Eisbock weizen? Interesting but bit strong.

Bottle at THT. Almost clear orange golden with off white head. Peach, lots of sweet malts, sweet pastry, quite some alcohol, spices, ginger. Over medium sweet and medium alcohol bitterness. Over medium bodied.

75cl bottle shared at August THT.
Thin white head. Hazy amber pour. A bit sweet. Pretty good.
Bottle shared at August THT. Hazy amber with a thin pink head. Notes of dried fruit, brandy, grapes, sugar. Full body, low carbonation, smooth texture and a sticky sweet finish.

375 ml bottle @ Timo A.BBE 15.01.2018. 
Pours clear amber color with a small head. Wheat on the nose, wood, mild hops, malts and yeast. Flavor is sweet wheat and apricot, some banana esters, spices and yeast, very distant metallic on the finish. Sweet sticky palate, some alcohol comes through.
5334

375 ml bottle. BB 15/01/2018. From a trade with Erzengel. Danke!
Clear amber color with a small light tan head.
Yeast, fruits, wheat, banana and sweetness in the aroma. 
Fruits, mild sourness, banana, sweetness, yeast and wheat in the flavor. Not bad. 


---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bouteille 375ml, BB 15.01.2018.
Orange-cuivre, col fin beige voire jaunâtre.
Arôme au nez fruité de raisin sec, malt pils, cara Munich, alcool parvient à percer avec une pointe de rétro levure allemande fin esters de bananes.
Palais est fort axé sur le s10% qui sortent bien, retrouve un léger malté grillé, caramel, pils et fruité noir + un caractère de raisin sec. Amertume arrive plus en fin de bouche apportant une fine pointe noble allemande. Huileux et collant aux lèvres sur la fin par le sucre résiduel. Tjrs en fin de bouche chaleur de lalcool demeure persistant. Décevante.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Dancing Camel. Thanks David Cohen. Cloudy deep orange. Nice aroma of fruity esters, caramel. Sweet flavor with malt, caramel, fruity esters, and a bit of alcohol. Medium-bodied.
Bottle and draft versions. More of a wheat wine really, with a nice liquid honey mouthfeel . Not for everyone but wheatheads should enjoy it.

Couleur ambrée trouble, très légère mousse. Nez fruité confit,note florale et herbeuse. Gout fruité confit, très sucré, alcool, note miel et genevrier. Corps lourd. Finalement pas assez subtile et suis decu alors que cest ma brasserie allemande préférée

Bottle 75cl shared by Calisky, a cloudy amber beer almost without head. Nose is very floral on juniper and elderflower. Aroma is on yellow fruits, sugar, candy sugar, juniper, very sweet, many and too much juniper and elderflower notes, almost undrinkable with a very high average of sugar. Very disappointed.

Une bière ambrée, pâle, peu de mousse. Un nez dominé par les céréales, le houblon, la levure. La bouche est fortement marquée par lalcool, les bulles quasi inexistantes et la finale ample. Une bière surprenante par sa dominante alcoolique.

Bottle @ home. 2016 vintage. Dried fruits combined with fresh sweet oranges, fermented apples and plums and fudge. Very sweet but hints of tartness and fruitiness weighs this up.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle 75 cl. Hazy dark golden with a medium white head, leaving some lacings. Aroma is sweet with dried fruit, wheat bread, honey, banana, some yeast and dust, some floral hint as well. Taste is fairly sweet with banana, dried fruit and bread, minnimal bitterness, some slight clove. Fairly big body with almost chewable texture, low carbo. A meal in itself. Pretty well hidden alcohol. Well done, a good "zipper".

Bottle at Internationales Berliner Bierfestival 2016. 

Hazy light amber with a medium head. Aroma of banana, yeast, malt and some dried fruit. Similar taste. Also some warming alcohol. The body was almost full and the finish long.

UPDATED: JAN 13, 2017 0.375 l bottle from biertraum.de, best before January 2018. Hazy, reddish amber with a thin, frothy, slowly diminishing, off-white head. Sweetish, malty, quite boozy and a bit yeasty-spicy aroma of peach, orange jam, pine, honey, vanilla, glue and some caramel. Very sweet, malty and moderately fruity taste of honey, peach, orange jam, pine, glue, some caramel and a touch of clove, followed by a rather long, slightly bitter, quite warming-alcoholic finish. Full body, very oily mouthfeel, almost flat. Too much alcohol and notes of glue detectable, otherwise a decent wheat wine. Quite different from what I expected though, doesnt have much to do with a Weizenbock.

Tap (Zly Casy, Prague)
Quite hot aroma, some marker pens, definitely says sweet. Hazy copper, small head. Big sweet body, raisiny. Sugary sweet palate, almost sticky. I normally like these guys, but they pushed this one too far. Its way too hot. Do I get liquorice? :-( Slimy if you let it warm at all.

Hazy dark amber color with off-white head. Aroma has dark, caramel malts and dried fruits. Taste starts with caramel, dark malts, fruits, tart macerated fruits, slight booze, very complex. Heavy bodied with low carbonation. Overall its a really tasty and complex brew. The only thing that bothers me is the alcohol presence.

Esters, intense molasses, caramel, biscuit, grain and bread malts. Hazy brown, very small, creamy head. Heavy sweet. Sweet grain and bread malts, caramel, molasses, sticky texture, soft carbonation. Nice Weizenbock, sweet esters, sugary and cheerful. Bottle from Wittich Weine und Biere, Olten.

375ml bottle. Murky amber colour with small, late awakening, creamy, half-way lasting, minimally lacing, off-white head. Slightly restricted, wheaty, fruity, yeasty and grassy-spicy hoppy aroma, notes of dried yellow stone fruit, apricot and peach, spicy notes of fresh hay, underlying hints of banana, baked banana, a touch of alcohol. Taste is moderately sweet fruity, notes of apricot jelly, mirabelle, peach, a cautious peppery spicy yeasty touch, spicy hints of fresh hay; full body, oily to viscous texture, soft palate.
From lacasadelacerveza. In Bavaria glass. Playing Grim Fandango. Very sweet, deliciously, not cloying. High ABV very well hidden. I had to drink it with fear

A dark orange, a head is quite small and blond. Aroma has fruitness of bananas and tropical notes of grapefruits, hint of yeast and spicyness, maybe also hint of alcohol. Taste has lots of bananas, some grapefruits, wheat, hint of spicyness. Smooth, easy to drink, medium bodied. The strong weizen with notes of grapes.

Bottle: Hazy amber color, off-white creamy head. Aroma is fruity, light alcoholic, raisins, banana, caramel. Flavor is full bodied and very fruity, notes of grapes, raisins, plums, overripe banana, caramel. Alcoholic, astringent finish.
Hefetrübes dunkles Bernstein mit durchschnittlicher Schaumkrone. Malzig, süßlich Waldhonig, etwas Karamell, Bananen, leicht alkoholisch, wenig Kohlensäure, ölig.

Bottle from Cornelius. Hazy amber body with a thin off-white head. Low carbonation. Faint lacing. Aroma of honey, liquorice and pine resin. Flavour of marmalade, sweet apricot and peppery spice. Medium body with a sticky mouthfeel. Soft fizz. Sweet and boozy and not particularly easy going.

9th June 2016Level 42 Bottle share. Thanks to Daniel. Hazy gold beer, thin white head. Palate is light and semi dry, reasonable fine carbonation. Nice caramel and banana. Mild dried fruits. Little spice. Smooth dry finish. Touch of ripe orange. Nice banana split beer!

0.75l bottle from hiebers, 6.99. pours a hazy amber with a small white head and no lacing. aroma of caramel, ripe banana, vanilla, alcohol. flavour of sweet apples, dates, toffee, vanilla. rather sweet. alcohol is not overpowering.

Appearance: Hazy amber with medium to low white head. Aroma: Sweet, riped banana, clove spiciness, overiped fruits, toffee and booze. Taste: Aromawise, sweet an boozy, overriped banana, caramel, spices and sugar.

Sample at a Systembolaget tasting. Fruity and slightly boozy smell with some dried and overly ripe fruit. Sweet taste with foam banana and some cloves. The taste was allot better then the smell. Need some friends to share this bottle.
Keg at hanging bat... Hazy Amber.. Thin white lacing... Soft sweet dry yeasty fruit bready nose.. Soft bready fruit

Red brown color with foam ring. Sweet red raisin and sugar nose. Super creamy, very alcoholic, sugar sirup, heavy fruity (dates, prunes) in the taste. Calm, creamy and very heavy satisfying raisin aftertaste. This beer is too much of everything and very dangerous to drink.

Pours a hazy dark amber color with medium white head that fades quickly. Sweet aroma, overriped banana, raisins, caramel, toffee, dried fruits and spice. Taste follows the aroma, sweet, lots of dried fruits, banana and caramel, with a stong but not unpleasant alcohol warming.

Bottle 375 ml. Amber color, good white foam. Aroma: madeira and barleywine, sweet nectar, raisins, strawberries, little floral, citrus and clove, esters. Taste: sweetness, gingerbread with honey, sweet white port wine, very warming, a little pepper, raisins and other dried fruit, candy, a little spicy. Not bad.

Draught at Taphouse.
Hazy orange colored with a small off-white head.
Fruity aroma of caramel and dried fruits with notes of marzipan.
Sweet and fruity flavor of caramel and dried fruits with notes of burnt sugar and marzipan.
Sweet finish.

Rating #2700. Bottle, vintage 2016 (from beer gonzo). Pours amber with whiteish head. The head stays for a moment. Aroma is bana, bruits, mango, caramel, alcohol, wheat. Flavor is sweet and bitter, fruits, mango, citrus, banana, somewhat juicy. Finish is citric sour, dry bitter with some alcohol. Overall: ok brew, but still disappointing for Schneider (its my lowest rated Schneider beer at the moment!).

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */, Copenhagen - orange Amber pour with small white head. Sweet fruity and malty with some nice notes of spice, some caramelic sweetness, yeasty and wheaty notes in the finish. Nice.
From tap at Taphouse. Hazy orange colour with a small white head. Aroma and flavour of malt, hops, fruit, spice, yeast and bitterness.
From tap. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma is fruity, toasted malty and caramelish. Sweet, fruity, caramelish. Toasted malty. Sweet and lingering fruity finish.

Draft. An unclear amber beer with a yellowish head. The aroma has notes of wheat, caramel, spices, and fruit. The flavor is sweet with notes of wheat, caramel, oranges, alcohol, and spices, leading to a dry wheaty finish.

Rerate from Tap at the tap house. Berry and flower aroma. Dark red Amber, offwhite cream. Meaty sweet base, a lot of rest sweetness, quite cloying. Candy aftertaste - badly dissolved berry sirup with a malt sugar component. 
Original rating at BKL2016: 5 3 6 3 12
Fairly phenolic boozy nose, surprised to find this in a Schneider
Cloudy orange brown, offwhite lace. 
Creamy mouthfeel, almond meal on the palate, apples, fermented pears, orange peel. Muddled, not ready yet?

Bottle shared on Level 42, 09/06/2016. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. Hazed dark orange coloured pour with a a loose white head. Aroma is tangy apple, doughy wheat, semi hot alcohol. Flavour is composed of banana, sweet caramel, banana, hot alcohol, Warming alcohol. Palate is sweet and sticky, moderate carbonation,. Rough round the edges.

37.5cl bottle shared at the Leightons Back tasting @42nd Level, CW. Many thanks to Daniel for this one. It pours a cleaner golden color with a small beige Head. Aroma is yeasty sweet with notes of caramel, banana and vomit. Taste is sweet yeasty and boozy with more notes of banana, vomit and toffee. Medium bodied with good carbonation. Overall, bad

Bottle. Bier Huis, Ossett. (You can rely on this place getting in unusual German stuff). Anyway, its hazy, gingery amber. Ring and film of off white head. Nose has banana toffee ice cream. Some vine fruit. Some bread yeast. Taste is vinous, fruity bitter. Some acidity. Thin mouthfeel for the ABV. Finishes tangy, fruity, bready sweet, with a light, spicy bitterness.

On tap at Chinaski Lavapiés, Madrid. Pours hazy amber with thin white head. Aroma of caramel, toffee, light wood, spices. Taste is sweet, grains, toffee. Full bodied, soft carbonation, thick. Barleywine like.

Bottle at level 42, thanks to Danny. It pours murky deep amber - brown with a small white head. The aroma is sweet, juicy, sticky, fruit cake, toffee, date, earth and brown sugar. The taste is sweet, fruit cake, brown banana, date, toffee, sugary fruit cake, fudge, banana split and plenty of alcohol boost. Medium body and fine carbonation. Banoffie pie character. A bit sweet and alcoholic for my personal taste, but its OK for the style.

Bottle shared at a tasting. Huge black banana nose with toffee, chocolate and some light grain. Pretty similar in taste but definitely sweet with a warming finish. Not bad, but a little messy for G. Schneider.

Bottle split at Level 42, thanks to DD, 09/06/16.
Hazed orange amber with a moderate off white cap.
Nose is toffee fudge, spice, orange peel, melted brown sugar, fruit loaf.
Taste comprises sweet melted toffee, light spice, sticky fruits, taffee fudge.
Full bodied, fine carbonation, sweet close with a boost.
Decent for style.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle shared in London - many thanks to Daniel. Pours cloudy gold with a creamy white head. Ripe banana on the nose, wheat bread. Medium sweet flavor with some butterscotch, bruised banana, sugary wheat bread, dough. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sugary finish with lots more bruised banana, doughy wheat bread. Tasty enough.

Bottle share at Floor 42 as Schneider Weisse Tap X Maries Rendezvous, 10%, picked up at Beer Boutique. Hazy murky orange, lightly sparkling, foamy off-white head, dotted lacing. Aroma is banana bread, clove, wheaty, bready. Body is smooth, tingly carbonation. Taste is banana bread, boozy, spicy, quite sweet, honey, banoffee, dry finish. A touch harsh but quite a nice flavour.

Bouteille(750ml):Amber with a reddish sheen, hazy, stable medium sized off-white head; sweet wheaty and caramelly nose, raisins surely in the background, "aromatic" hops hardly detectable; solid sweet flavour, light acidity, molecular bitter traces; full bodied, soft MF; lingering sweet and slightly sourish fruity-yeasty finish. Disappointing

Tap (Zly Casy, Prague). Hazy dark amber color. Thick and sturdy off-white head, stays. Sweet, caramel, faint banana, sourish, wheat and toffee in aroma. Alcohol, sourish, currant, jammy, toffee and roast in taste. Sweet, sour and toffee in aftertaste. Solid brew.
Hazy amber. Super phenolic, lots bananas and cloves with a touch of caramel. Thick but lacking depth. Decent but not overly great.

Bottle. Thanks, Mike. Creamy, malty nose, with stone fruit, and small alcohol fumes. Dark amber color. Moderately thick wheaty malty initial, thin stream of stone fruit, some alcohol presence throughout. Medium bodied and warming. Balanced, with moderate sweetness. Nice. Hides alcohol fairly well.

Bottle. Orange-amber, hazy, with lace--almost flat. Nice nose, banana, clove, orange, peach, caramel, honey. Sweet honey flavor, nice tartness, lemon. Decent prickly bitterness. Entirely too flat, though, soapy and oily. Delicious, but the carbonation is wrong.

On tap. Creamy beige head, well-formed, a bit persistent. Excellent feel in the mouth, lingers after each sip. Though containing a high level of alcohol, it is well-balanced and easy to drink. Worth seeking...

(tap 0,3l @ OP (Brno))
Aroma: Spicy, alcohol, citrusy.
Appearance: Cloudy dark golden color. Creamy, off-white head.
Taste: Very sweet, light bitter, strong spicy, light citrusy.
Palate: Full body. Bitter, light astringent finish.
Overall: Nice, full, strong, spicy.
2016 bottle. Dark amber color. Vinous aroma with floral notes and a hint of smoke. Full bodied. malty sweet. Dried fruit, citrus. Vinous. Hint of smoke. Quite intense.
375ml bottle from Salt Horse, shared with jeevan. Pours hazy yellow gold with a thin white head. Aromas of banana, sweet malt. Taste is light spice, sweet bread. Sticky finish.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2016 Farbe: orange-braun, trübe.Schaum: fein sämig aber schnell reduziertNase: orange holz malz Grapefruit Aprikose Geschmack: fühlt sich fast zähflüssig voll an. Aber auch recht frisch und bitter. Im Abgang kommt wieder der orangenhammer. Dann ein bisschen erdig mit viel Getreide.Ziemlich schwer aber auch ziemlich gut. Hm von anderen: überreife Banane beschreibt den Geruch auch gut.

Thanks to SinH4 for the bottle! Murky looking, dark orange, carbonation builds a rather creamy white head. Aroma is banana cake, hints of clove. Taste is sweet, low bitterness, some hints of alcohol harshness. Medium to full body. Average carbonation. On the thicker side wit h a long finish.

Bottle at Cafe Abseits Bamberg. Hazy amber russet colour lasting beige head. Finishing beer. big weizenbock aroma with lots of hop. rich toffee esters hops on aroma. mouth is more caramel and toffee with an earthy cascade finish. i mean it is big toffee no doubt. its a hell of a beer. Hoppy toffèe esters. Wow. Big satisfying and a great finishing beer. Im done. Stick a fork in me.
Bottle at salthorse. Pours deep amber, nose is pineapple, banana, caramel, taste is similar, sweet, toffee.
Bottle at Erzbierschof Monday Club. Lots and lots of banana and booze, warming and creamy. Short finish. Fruity.

Keg at Beermoth. Pours amber brown. Bose is sweet caramel, ripe banana, bready malts, dried fruits. Tastes sweet, spices like cloves, dried fruits, malts. It is also alcoholic but good if you get it in small portions.
Bottle (1. Stuttgarter Craft Beer Festival). Pours a light brown color. Aroma of yeasts, malt, apples and apricots.

14/IV/16 - 37.5cl bottle from Geers (Oostakker) @ home - BB: 15/I/18 (2016-354) Thanks to Akke for the bottle!
Clear dark orange to amber beer, tiny off-white to yellow head, little stable, non adhesive. Aroma: quite a bit of banana, very malty, bit of a sourish impression, bread, oranges. MF: soft carbon, medium to full body. Taste: bit sourish, alcohol, very malty, banana, fruity, slightly bitter. Aftertaste: lots of banana, sourish, alcohol, bit malty, lemony, somewhat metallic, soft bitterness.
Tap at Salon piva. Very intense maltiness with lots of dried fruits, caramel, banana, clove. Assertive hoppiness mixed in masterfully as well. Citrusy. Excellent beer.
Helles braun gelb schöner schaum, Geruch viel Johannisbeere und Malz, Geschmack komplex und schwer Beeren malzig süß dunkles Karamell reife Banane
Tap at Salon piva. Coppery color, medium white head. Aroma is typical weizeny, banana, cloves, spices, caramel. Taste is sweety with warming alcohol

0,1l from tap at Salon Piva. amber very hazy / light cloudy color, small off-white head. smells of caramel, some sweetness, spices, quite fruity, peach, banana, some yeast. nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes rather sweet, quite fruity, peach, spices, light berry notes, bit glueish, light alcohol noticeable. finishes lightly sweet with notes of peach and spices, also light glueish. good stuff, drinks nice, but rather heavy and alcoholic. I like it.

375 ml. bottle split with tderoeck & kraddel. Courtesy of tderoeck. THX! BBF 15.01.2015. Deep hazy orange, with little off-white head. Nose is very interesting , sweetness is heavy, less banana & more almost like rice pudding, cheesecake, oily vanilla, raisin, crazy thick wheat, big too much fish guts / DE yeast profile. Taste is vanilla, sugar, rice cake, thick DE fish guts yeast, very thick sweet wheat, raisin, big pleasant sweetness, very warming going to boozy almost. Very thick, sweet wheat bodied. DE fish guts profile takes this one a touch down for me but otherwise this is a very interesting imperial kind of beer that offers some interesting unusual note. Very hefe / weizen like but also imperial in its approach, took some getting used to but I enjoyed it. BA version might be interesting or maybe a somewhat altered recipe.

From tap at Damian Beer&Ale stand at Salon Piva craft beer festival, Bratislava, Pours cloudy golden amber liquid, small frothy white head, Aroma: rose flower, citrus, strawberry, orange zest, wheat, Taste: medium to heavy sweet, medium- harsh bitter, medium sour, strange sourish harsh bitter, floral, citrus, lemon peel, fruity - strawberry?, Palate: medium body, soft to average carbonation, slick to creamy mouthfeel, Overall: did not realy enjoyed.
Thnx to Tderoeck. pours unclear amber/orange. Small white head. Smell is fruity, bitter, yeasty and malts. Taste is sharp, dry, fruity yeasty, somewhat bitter. Ok

sample from draft, 2016 net batch, hazy yellow golden colour with a white head. nose of caramel, peaches, dried apricots, ripe banana, sweet apples, malty, slightly tart in the finish, yeast, alcoholic finish. weird...
Aus der Flasche. hellbraun trübes Bier. Grober Schaum. Duft nach roter Johannisbeere. Hefe und Süsse im Antrunk . Komplex. Rote Beeren. Harz, Hefe Banane. Ein Spannendes Bier.

Nicely presented bottle 375ml, pours cloudy red amber with some murk. Lots of nose of banana, very impressive so far. Full bodied wheat malt backbone, developing into apple pie and stewed plum. Lots of sweetness from the malts but is balanced well and the finish is fairly dry and drinks smoothly considering the abv. Texture is creamy, carbonation is very soft to flat. I do like a good wheat beer, and this is not bad at all.

Bottle looks really good. Beer in the glass brownish, nice head. Malty-alcoholic aroma. Starts strong, intense malty and yeasty, some alcoholic-sharp notes. Fruity hints of plum. Light sourish. Finish a bit rusty, warming-alcoholic, dry-hoppy. Could be a bit more balanced. I liked it but I can imagine not everyone does.

It is seasinal unfiltered beer. It is blurred appearence but its taste is remarkable. It is well-balanced, smooth, leaving off fruity taste at the final. Despite containing of 10% alcohol, you do not feel its bitterness.
High alcohol volume ( 10 % ).It is a fantastic ale from schneider.It is avaliable for short period.You have to try...

Bottle.Murky dark golden body with white head. Aroma is sweet and ripe fruits some yeast and also alcohol. Taste is also fruity and malty with some spices and also alcohol. Aftertaste is sweet with alcohol and low bitterness. Liked it but I think this will be much better with some aging.

(bottle) murky golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of honey-tinged pale malts, some light cheesecake and ethanol, quite phenolic, with a touch of floral hops and apricot schnaps. flavour is mostly peaches and caramel, very meaty and sweet, with a light touch of cherry syrup, some peanuts and a rather boozy finish. heavy-bodied with average carbonation.

From bottle at BKL München 2016.
Amber-copper, hazy body, with a small, creamy, light beige head.
Aroma of dried and ripe fruits, ripe banana, vanilla, citrus, berries, some spices.
Taste follows this, with some more booze.
Medium, creamy mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes boozy, sweet, fruity, spicy, a bit dry, yeasty.

Nice one, although slightly disappointing. Reminds me a bit of a stronger, boozy Hopfenweisse, but not as fruity, complex or characterful. Actually a bit uninspired compared to prevoius Tap X brews, definitely my least favourite from this series so far.

Aroma: malty and sweet, alcohol.
Appearance: golden color and almost no head.
Taste: really sweet, some cloves, alcohol, astringent.
Palate: medium body and medium carbonation.
Overall: Travesty.

Trübes dunkel orange goldenes Bier mit stabilen mittelgroßen leicht beigen Schaumkrone. Geruch nach sehr reifen Bananen, dörrobst, Hefe. Geschmack sehr süß bananig, reifes Obst, Hefe, spürbar alkoholisch.
Heller, viel zu süßer Antrunk. Alkoholisch, leicht würzig. Unrund, kurzer süß wässriger Nachhall. 12/7/7/6/12/7

UPDATED: JUN 30, 2016 Orange-golden color with tan head. Aroma is fruity, not so many bananas, spicy, quite surprising. Very intense musty fruitiness, and the phenolicness is like a Hopfenweisse without the hops. A bit irritating. Taste is phenolic, spicy, hints of honey and darker fruits. Very phenolic-boozy, warming finish. Silky mouthfeel.Not bad, but extremely intense, and quite a letdown from what I?ve expected. Way too boozy. I am not yet sure what to think of this. It?s not bad per se, Schneider has never brewed a bad beer imho, but even if you accept the heavy booziness and mustiness, it?s not excellent. I?ll give it another chance some time. Most people I?ve talked to at Braukunst thought it was particularly bad.EDIT: Tried again at the last BKL16 day. This definitely needs some time in the bottle. I can?t help but think they didn?t have full control over this, which is very unexpected from Schneider. I still think it?s good if you are fine with very intense Weizenbocks and some mustyness, but I did have very high expectations. Let?s see if it gets better after a few months in the bottle, I really hope so.EDIT: Tap, in June 2016. Not as crazily musty, but too much umami now, and still a huge letdown for Schneider standards. Adjusted from 3.5 to 3.2, although this would more be a 2.7....

EDIT: Bottle end of June 2016. Still not better. Nope.
